name: CanvasForm
comment:
CanvasForm is an implementation of abstract class [`VisualForm`](#link). It provide methods to express Pts on [`CanvasSpace`](#link).
You may extend CanvasForm to implement your own expressions for CanvasSpace.

signatures.comment: Create a new CanvasForm. You may also use [`CanvasSpace.getForm()`](#link) to get the default form.

parameters.name: space
parameters.comment: an instance of CanvasSpace

accessors.name: ctx
accessors.comment: Get the rendering context of canvas to perform other canvas functions.

accessors.name: currentFont
accessors.comment: Get the current font in use in this form.

accessors.name: filled
accessors.comment: Check whether this form currently has fill style.

accessors.name: ready
accessors.comment: get whether the Form has received the Space's rendering context.

accessors.name: space
accessors.comment: get the CanvasSpace instance that this form is associated with

accessors.name: stroked
accessors.comment: Check whether this form currently has stroke style.

signatures.comment: Set text alignment and baseline (eg, vertical-align).

parameters.name: alignment
parameters.comment: HTML canvas' textAlign option: "left", "right", "center", "start", or "end"

parameters.name: baseline
parameters.comment: HTML canvas' textBaseline option: "top", "hanging", "middle", "alphabetic", "ideographic", "bottom". For convenience, you can also use "center" (same as "middle"), and "baseline" (same as "alphabetic")

signatures.comment: Set current alpha value.

parameters.name: a
parameters.comment: alpha value between 0 and 1

signatures.comment: Draw an arc.

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: center position

parameters.name: radius
parameters.comment: radius of the arc circle

parameters.name: startAngle
parameters.comment: start angle of the arc

parameters.name: endAngle
parameters.comment: end angle of the arc

parameters.name: cc
parameters.comment: an optional boolean value to specify if it should be drawn clockwise (`false`) or counter-clockwise (`true`). Default is clockwise.

signatures.comment: Draw a circle. See also [`Circle.fromCenter`](#link)

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: usually a Group of 2 Pts, but it can also take an array of two numeric arrays [ [position], [size] ]

signatures.comment: Draw multiple circles at once.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.comment: an array of Groups that defines multiple circles

signatures.comment: Create a clipping mask from the current path. See [MDN documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/clip) for details.

Set composite operation (also known as blend mode). You can also call this function without parameters to get back to default 'source-over' mode. See [MDN documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/globalCompositeOperation) for the full list of operations you can use.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.comment: a composite operation such as 'lighten', 'multiply', 'overlay', and 'color-burn'.

signatures.comment: Activate dashed stroke and set dash style. You can customize the segments and offset.

parameters.name: segments
parameters.comment: Dash segments. Defaults to `true` which corresponds to `[5, 5]`. Pass `false` to deactivate dashes. (See [canvas documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/setLineDash))

parameters.name: offset
parameters.comment: Dash offset. Defaults to 0. (See [canvas documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset)

signatures.comment: A static function to draw an ellipse.

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: center position

parameters.name: radius
parameters.comment: radius [x, y] of the ellipse

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.comment: rotation of the ellipse in radian. Default is 0.

parameters.name: startAngle
parameters.comment: start angle of the ellipse. Default is 0.

parameters.name: endAngle
parameters.comment: end angle of the ellipse. Default is 2 PI.

parameters.name: cc
parameters.comment: an optional boolean value to specify if it should be drawn clockwise (`false`) or counter-clockwise (`true`). Default is clockwise.

signatures.comment: Set current fill style. Provide a valid color string such as `"#FFF"` or `"rgba(255,0,100,0.5)"` or `false` to specify no fill color.

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: fill color which can be as color, gradient, or pattern. (See [canvas documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/fillStyle))

signatures.comment: Set current fill style and remove stroke style. (not implemented here  -- to be implemented in subclasses).

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: fill color as string or `false` to specify transparent.

signatures.comment: Set the current font.

parameters.name: sizeOrFont
parameters.comment: either a number to specify font-size, or a `Font` object to specify all font properties

parameters.name: weight
parameters.comment: Optional font-weight string such as "bold"

parameters.name: style
parameters.comment: Optional font-style string such as "italic"

parameters.name: lineHeight
parameters.comment: Optional line-height number suchas 1.5

parameters.name: family
parameters.comment: Optional font-family such as "Helvetica, sans-serif"

signatures.comment: Set whether to use html canvas' [`measureText`](#link) function, or a faster but less accurate heuristic function.

parameters.name: estimate
parameters.comment: `true` to use heuristic function, or `false` to use ctx.measureText

signatures.comment: Get the width of this text. It will return an actual measurement or an estimate based on [`fontWidthEstimate`](#link) setting. Default is an actual measurement using canvas context's measureText.

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: a string of text contents

signatures.comment: This function takes an array of gradient colors, and returns a function to define the areas of the gradient fill. See demo code in [CanvasForm.gradient](https://ptsjs.org/demo/?name=canvasform.textBox).
signatures.returns_comment: a function that takes 1 or 2 `Group` as parameters. Use a single `Group` to specify a rectangular area for linear gradient, or use 2 `Groups` to specify 2 `Circles` for radial gradient.

parameters.name: stops
parameters.comment: an array of gradient stops. This can be an array of colors `["#f00", "#0f0", ...]` for evenly distributed gradient, or an array of [stop, color] like `[[0.1, "#f00"], [0.7, "#0f0"]]`

tags.text: `c1 = Circle.fromCenter(...); grad = form.gradient(["#f00", "#00f"]); form.fill( grad( c1, c2 ) ).circle( c1 )`

signatures.comment: Draw an image.

parameters.name: img
parameters.comment: an [`ImageBitmap`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmap) instance (eg the image from ``, `

parameters.name: target
parameters.comment: a target area to place the image. Either a Pt specifying a position, or a Group that specifies a bounding box (top-left position, bottom-right position). Default is (0,0) at top-left.

signatures.comment: Draw a line or polyline.

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of multiple Pts, or an array of multiple numeric arrays

signatures.comment: Draw multiple lines at once.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.comment: An array of Groups of Pts

signatures.comment: A convenient way to draw some text on canvas for logging or debugging. It'll be draw on the top-left of the canvas as an overlay.

parameters.name: txt
parameters.comment: text

signatures.comment: Fit multi-line text in a rectangular box. Note that this will also set canvas context's textBaseline to "top".

parameters.name: box
parameters.comment: a rectangle box defined by a Group

parameters.name: txt
parameters.comment: string of text

parameters.name: lineHeight
parameters.comment: line height as a ratio of font size. Default is 1.2.

parameters.name: verticalAlign
parameters.comment: "top", "middle", or "bottom" to specify vertical alignment inside the box

parameters.name: crop
parameters.comment: a boolean to specify whether to crop text when overflowing

signatures.comment: Draws a point.

parameters.name: p
parameters.comment: a Pt object

parameters.name: radius
parameters.comment: radius of the point. Default is 5.

parameters.name: shape
parameters.comment: The shape of the point. Defaults to "square", but it can be "circle" or a custom shape function in your own implementation.

signatures.comment: Draw multiple points at once.

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: an array of Pt or an array of number arrays

parameters.name: radius
parameters.comment: radius of the point. Default is 5.

parameters.name: shape
parameters.comment: The shape of the point. Defaults to "square", but it can be "circle" or a custom shape function in your own implementation.

signatures.comment: Draw a polygon.

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of multiple Pts, or an array of multiple numeric arrays

signatures.comment: Draw multiple polygons at once.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.comment: An array of Groups of Pts

signatures.comment: Draw a rectangle.

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: usually a Group of 2 Pts specifying the top-left and bottom-right positions. Alternatively it can be an array of numeric arrays.

signatures.comment: Draw multiple rectangles at once.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.comment: An array of Groups of Pts

signatures.comment: Render the offscreen canvas's content on the visible canvas

parameters.name: offset
parameters.comment: Optional offset on the top-left position when drawing on the visible canvas

signatures.comment: Reset the rendering context's common styles to this form's styles. This supports using multiple forms on the same canvas context.
Draw a square, given a center and its half-size.

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: center Pt

parameters.name: halfsize
parameters.comment: half-size

signatures.comment: Draw multiple squares at once.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.comment: an array of Groups that defines multiple circles

signatures.comment: Set current stroke style. Provide a valid color string or `false` to specify no stroke color.

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: stroke color which can be as color, gradient, or pattern. (See [canvas documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/strokeStyle))

parameters.name: width
parameters.comment: Optional value (can be floating point) to set line width

parameters.name: linejoin
parameters.comment: Optional string to set line joint style. Can be "miter", "bevel", or "round".

parameters.name: linecap
parameters.comment: Optional string to set line cap style. Can be "butt", "round", or "square".

signatures.comment: Set stroke style and remove fill style. (not implemented here  -- to be implemented in subclasses).

parameters.name: c
parameters.comment: stroke color as string or `false` to specify transparent.

parameters.name: width
parameters.comment: Optional value (can be floating point) to set line width

parameters.name: linejoin
parameters.comment: Optional string to set line joint style. Can be "miter", "bevel", or "round".

parameters.name: linecap
parameters.comment: Optional string to set line cap style. Can be "butt", "round", or "square".

signatures.comment: Draw text on canvas.
Fit a single-line text in a rectangular box.

parameters.name: box
parameters.comment: a rectangle box defined by a Group

parameters.name: txt
parameters.comment: string of text

parameters.name: verticalAlign
parameters.comment: "top", "middle", or "bottom" to specify vertical alignment inside the box

parameters.name: tail
parameters.comment: text to indicate overflow such as "...". Default is empty "".

parameters.name: overrideBaseline
parameters.comment: If `true`, use the corresponding baseline as verticalAlign. If `false`, use the current canvas context's textBaseline setting. Default is `true`.

signatures.comment: Toggle whether to draw on offscreen canvas (if offscreen is set in CanvasSpace)

parameters.name: off
parameters.comment: if `true`, draw on offscreen canvas instead of the visible canvas. Default is `true`

parameters.name: clear
parameters.comment: optionally provide a valid color string to fill a bg color. see CanvasSpace's `clearOffscreen` function.

signatures.comment: A static function to draw an arc.

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.comment: canvas rendering context

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: center position

parameters.name: radius
parameters.comment: radius of the arc circle

parameters.name: startAngle
parameters.comment: start angle of the arc

parameters.name: endAngle
parameters.comment: end angle of the arc

parameters.name: cc
parameters.comment: an optional boolean value to specify if it should be drawn clockwise (`false`) or counter-clockwise (`true`). Default is clockwise.

signatures.comment: A static function to draw a circle.

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.comment: canvas rendering context

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: center position of the circle

parameters.name: radius
parameters.comment: radius of the circle

signatures.comment: A static function to draw an ellipse.

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.comment: canvas rendering context

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: center position

parameters.name: radius
parameters.comment: radius [x, y] of the ellipse

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.comment: rotation of the ellipse in radian. Default is 0.

parameters.name: startAngle
parameters.comment: start angle of the ellipse. Default is 0.

parameters.name: endAngle
parameters.comment: end angle of the ellipse. Default is 2 PI.

parameters.name: cc
parameters.comment: an optional boolean value to specify if it should be drawn clockwise (`false`) or counter-clockwise (`true`). Default is clockwise.

signatures.comment: A static function to draw an image.

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.comment: canvas rendering context

parameters.name: img
parameters.comment: an [`ImageBitmap`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmap) instance (eg the image from ``, `

parameters.name: target
parameters.comment: a target area to place the image. Either a Pt specifying a position, or a Group that specifies a bounding box (top-left position, bottom-right position). Default is (0,0) at top-left.

parameters.name: orig
parameters.comment: a Group (top-left position, bottom-right position) that specifies a cropping box  in the original target.

signatures.comment: A static function to draw a line or polyline.

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.comment: canvas rendering context

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of multiple Pts, or an array of multiple numeric arrays

signatures.comment: A static function to draw a polygon.

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.comment: canvas rendering context

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: a Group of multiple Pts, or an array of multiple numeric arrays

signatures.comment: A static function to draw a rectangle.

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.comment: canvas rendering context

parameters.name: pts
parameters.comment: usually a Group of 2 Pts specifying the top-left and bottom-right positions. Alternatively it can be an array of numeric arrays.

signatures.comment: A static function to draw a square.

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.comment: canvas rendering context

parameters.name: pt
parameters.comment: center position of the square

parameters.name: halfsize
parameters.comment: half size of the square

signatures.comment: A static function to draw text.

parameters.name: ctx
parameters.comment: canvas rendering context
